user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of ahc_echo:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
ahc_echo (void *cls,
          struct MHD_Connection *connection,
          const char *url,
          const char *method,
          const char *version,
          const char *upload_data, size_t *upload_data_size, void **req_cls)
{
  (void) cls;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) url;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) version;           /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) upload_data;       /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) upload_data_size;  /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) req_cls;           /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */

  if (0 != strcmp (method, "GET"))
    return MHD_NO;              /* unexpected method */
  return MHD_queue_response (connection, MHD_HTTP_OK, response);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I selected the entire ahc_echo function because its static linkage makes the whole function a candidate for being unreachable code if it is not referenced anywhere in the translation unit or project; that is the primary concern under MISRA C Rule 2.1. No other separate fragments outside this function exist in the supplied snippet.

Why other parts need not be investigated separately: the two return statements are reachable at runtime depending on the value of method (so there is no obvious code after a return that is statically unreachable). The (void) casts are intentional idioms to suppress unused-parameter warnings and do not themselves create unreachable code. There are no constructs such as code appearing after an unconditional return, infinite loops that make following code unreachable, or labels/gotos that render subsequent code unreachable within the provided snippet. Therefore the focus for MISRA 2.1 investigation should be whether the static function ahc_echo is ever called (i.e. whether the function itself is unreachable) rather than the individual lines inside it.
